intro: Nephroia triloba, commonly known as the three-lobed nephroia, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in summer. Its stems are often hairy, and it produces small, berry-like fruits that contain seeds. Nephroia triloba is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
